a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Poverty: Share of population living on less than $8.30 a day (after vs.
The poverty line of $8.30 per day is set by the World Bank to be representative of the definitions of poverty adopted in
upper-middle-income countries. This data is adjusted for inflation and differences in living costs between countries. Income

has been
equivalized
â€“ adjusted to account for the fact that people in the same household can share costs like rent and

Note: This data is expressed in
international-$
at 2021 prices.
